title: Ticket #6377: split docker run into docker create + docker start
description: Currently, docker universe jobs are started with the "docker run" command, which does two things -- it creates the container, potentially fetching the image, and runs the job in the container. Newer versions of docker now support splitting these operations into their component parts -- a "docker create" command, which does the fetching and provisioning of the container, and a "docker start", which simply starts the command in the given container. This is like a fork + exec. Changing docker universe to use the latter pair gives us the opportunity to better detect and report errors, and to more accurate account for usage and status.
